summary: The document is a memorandum from Frederick C. Randall, Chief of the DDO/Privacy and Information Coordinator, to the Chief of the Information and Privacy Staff, dated August 1976. It addresses a request (No. P-76-1140) concerning Edwin Anderson Walker, indicating that the Directorate does not maintain a file on Walker but references a single FBI report related to him. This report, originating from Boston, Massachusetts, on 26 December 1972, pertains to the Boston Scientists and Engineers for Social and Political Action (SESPA) under the category of Internal Security- REVACT. The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: The Directorate does not have a file on Edwin Anderson Walker.
Only one FBI report mentioning Walker was found, related to SESPA in Boston.
The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
Boston Scientists and Engineers for Social and Political Action
